radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal bilateral lower lobe dependent atelectasis, moderately distended gallbladder with mild circumferential wall thickening, mild-to-moderate pericholecystic fat stranding, focally disrupted mucosa along gallbladder fundus concerning for early or impending perforation, tiny stones in the gallbladder, normal common duct, punctate calcification in spleen possibly related to prior granulomatous disease, mild fatty atrophy of pancreas, unremarkable kidneys with a 5.1-cm simple cyst, colonic diverticulosis without evidence of diverticulitis, normal appendix, no free fluid or air in abdomen, prominent portacaval nodes, multilevel degenerative changes of thoracolumbar spine.
